snippet: Hispanics — a demographic coveted by both political parties in this election year — accounted for nearly a third of the increase in adults with insurance, according to a New York Times analysis.
abstract: New York Times analysis of impact of Affordable Care Act finds expansion of coverage over past year has ended decades-old increase in gap between those who have insurance and those who do not; details of study, which shows very significant gains in coverage for immigrants, highlighted.

byline.original: By SABRINA TAVERNISE and ROBERT GEBELOFF

lead_paragraph: Hispanics — a demographic coveted by both political parties in this election year — accounted for nearly a third of the increase in adults with insurance, according to a New York Times analysis.

headline.main: Immigrants, the Poor and Minorities Gain Sharply Under Affordable Care Act
headline.print_headline: One Year Later, Many Are Finding Relief in Health Care Law

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
